title: Gastown Viewer Intent MVP
description:
Local-first Mission Control for Beads + Gastown-style agent swarms.

MVP delivers:
- Go daemon with HTTP JSON API on localhost:7070
- TUI client (Bubbletea) consuming API
- Web UI (Vite + React + TypeScript) consuming API
- Board view + issue details + graph export
- Events stream (SSE preferred; polling acceptable)

Done when:
- make dev starts daemon + web
- TUI shows board and opens issue details
- API returns valid JSON for all endpoints
- Graceful error when Beads not initialized

title: Domain model + event schema
description:
Define core domain types in internal/model/:
- Issue struct (id, title, status, priority, parent, children, blocks, blocked_by, timestamps)
- Board struct (columns by status, issue summaries)
- Graph struct (nodes, edges with dependency types)
- Event types for SSE (issue_created, issue_updated, heartbeat)

Done when:
- internal/model/issue.go exists with Issue struct
- internal/model/board.go exists with Board + Column structs
- internal/model/graph.go exists with Graph, Node, Edge structs
- internal/model/event.go exists with Event types
- go build ./internal/model/... succeeds

title: Beads adapter via bd CLI
description:
Implement internal/beads.Adapter interface that shells out to bd CLI:
- ListIssues(ctx, filters) []Issue
- GetIssue(ctx, id) Issue
- Board(ctx) Board
- Graph(ctx) Graph

Implementation:
- Execute bd commands (bd list, bd show, bd board, bd blocked)
- Parse output with graceful degradation
- Return partial data + warnings on parse errors
- Never panic on unexpected output

Done when:
- internal/beads/adapter.go defines Adapter interface
- internal/beads/cli.go implements CLI executor
- internal/beads/parser.go handles output parsing
- Unit tests with mock bd output pass
- Returns clear error if bd not found

title: Daemon HTTP API + SSE events
description:
Implement gvid daemon in cmd/gvid/:
- HTTP server on localhost:7070
- JSON API at /api/v1/*
- SSE endpoint at /api/v1/events
- CORS for localhost:5173 (web dev)

Endpoints:
- GET /api/v1/health - returns {status, beads_initialized, version}
- GET /api/v1/issues - list with optional filters (status, parent, search)
- GET /api/v1/issues/:id - single issue with children/deps
- GET /api/v1/board - board view grouped by status
- GET /api/v1/graph - dependency graph (JSON, optional DOT)
- GET /api/v1/events - SSE stream

Done when:
- go run ./cmd/gvid starts server on :7070
- curl http://localhost:7070/api/v1/health returns JSON
- All endpoints return valid JSON or SSE
- Returns 503 with actionable error if beads not initialized

title: TUI client consuming API
description:
Implement gvi-tui in cmd/gvi-tui/ using Bubbletea:
- Connects to daemon API (default http://localhost:7070)
- Board view (columns + counts)
- Issue list (filter/search)
- Issue details (children + deps)
- Keyboard navigation

Done when:
- go run ./cmd/gvi-tui starts TUI
- Board view shows issues grouped by status
- Can navigate to issue details with Enter
- Shows error if daemon not running
- q quits cleanly

title: Web UI consuming API
description:
Implement web UI in web/ using Vite + React + TypeScript:
- Board view with columns
- Issue detail side panel
- Polling for updates (SSE optional for MVP)
- Tailwind or simple CSS

Done when:
- cd web && npm run dev starts on :5173
- Board shows issues grouped by status
- Click issue opens detail panel
- Shows children and dependencies
- Error state if daemon not running

title: Dev tooling + docs in 000-docs
description:
Finalize developer experience:
- Makefile targets: dev, test, build, clean
- README with quickstart, architecture, API overview
- 000-docs/ with PRD, ADR, API spec (from templates)
- .gitignore, .editorconfig, LICENSE

Done when:
- make dev starts daemon + web (parallel)
- make test runs go test + web lint
- make build produces binaries in bin/
- README has working quickstart
- All 000-docs files complete

title: MVP demo + sanity checks
description:
Final verification of MVP:
- End-to-end test: daemon -> TUI -> Web
- Demo script for walkthrough
- Verify all acceptance criteria from PRD

Done when:
- make dev starts successfully
- TUI connects and shows board
- Web UI loads and shows board
- API health returns {status: "ok", beads_initialized: true}
- Can view issue details in both TUI and Web
- bd ready shows no blocked MVP issues
